reviewText: Other reviewers are right, this is ridiculously (not in a good way) brief, considering the price, with each feature just a few minutes long. But devotees of minions are the sort who can't resist these little guys. We even likeDuck Brand Despicable Me [Minions!] Printed Duct Tape."Home Makeover" - Features a welcome return to Margo, Edith, and Agnes, who must make Gru's decor (while he's away) look child-friendly before an inspection by a social worker. They recruit the minions to hide all the pointy, spiky Gru-stuff; home renovation was never so charming."Orientation Day" - Brilliant. Supervisors would be well-put to play this to lighten the mood for staff while encouraging team-building. During minion Orientation Day, Gru's newest little yellow guys begin their training, learning the ways of work; perfection!"Banana" - Minions are funny about fruit (and a lot of other things). It makes sense they love bananas, and have trouble resisting snacks. One little guy succumbs, and other minions want to take his treat away.The bonus portion is unfortunately less successful; it lacks the adorable minion voice - Pierre Coffin. These "Super Silly Fun Land" games include: "Minion Dunk Tank," "Feed the Creatures," "Tin Can Alley," and "Match Madness."
summary: Too Pricey, but Minions are Irresistible

reviewText: My grandson wanted to see this as he loves Despicable Me and the minions.  We thought this was going to be a lot of fun to watch with him.  There are three cartoons on the disk and they are cute and hilarious.  Then the fun stops!Home Maker is 3 minutes and 52 seconds long.Orientation Day is 3 minutes and 35 seconds long.Banana is 3 minutes and 18 seconds long.That does not include the credits after the cartoons or the commercials before the cartoons start.  There are commercials to sell your children more movies that are longer than the minion cartoons.  Universal should be embarrassed to sell something like this. It is titled as 3 MINI MOVIES and it should have been called 3 MICRO MOVIES.There are some games on the disk that you can play with your DVD controller and but they are pretty bad.  Save your money and don't get this.  While it is cute it is not worth $1.34 per minute!
summary: 10 minutes and 45 seconds of cartoons sold at the price of a full DVD movie!

reviewText: Those who have never seen either of the 'Despicable Me' animated films have missed one of the great comic inventions of recent times: 'The Minions'. These whacked-out, be-goggled yellow lozenges have their own language, cultural vibe and above all else...they are just plain FUNNY.'Minion Madness' is three shorts about these manic little guys. The first, is funny, cute and acts as a bridge between the two 'Despicable Me' feature films. The second will bring giggles and snorts to anyone who has had to sit through a new-hire orientation; or, had to deal with clueless 'newbie' employees. The last short ('Bananas') is vintage slapstick at its purest. It channels the shorts of Mack Sennett and The Three Stooges...a gem.For those who have seen either/both 'Despicable Me' films, this is a must-see. For those who luv slapstick and/or great funny animation...same deal.
summary: Goofy slapstick in the tradition of the 'The Three Stooges'
